Description: Bronze chisel, sqaure-sectioned at one end, and tapering to a cutting edge.
Curator's comments: For examples of copper alloy chisels found at Deir el-Medina, see Les artistes de pharaon (2002): 197 [122]. However, this type of plain chisel was employed throughout the dynastic era
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2005-2006 22 Feb-29 May, London, The Jewish Museum, Passover
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
